text: Hey there, was wondering if it's possible to add  WYSIWYG content editor as column type in HubDB table ? I know it's possible to add a simple rich text, but its not possible to embed image/video inside the content editor.
No Unfortunately it isnt possible yet.
Thanks Chad, do you know of other ways to achieve this? - To be able to embed media files inside a rich-text  column type ?
you should be able to import rich data to the column, you just can't edit it through HubSpot's GUI
have to export to csv, manually add the html to the columns, then import the csv

Thanks Stefen, importing rich-data isnt the issue, its adding media content such as videos/images inside a rich-text. Currently there seem to be no way to do that and I don't want to create a separate columns for media files.
<@U7V9DQ31P> Wait, are you saying that you can get around the GUI limitations by uploading via CSV?
<@U54TVT3C1> yes, i can confirm you can use h2's n' such but can't say i've tried iframes

Just a heads up if youâ€™re doing a lot of editing via CSV.  If you are referencing a table via a foreign id column and then update that table via csv, it will break all foreign id references without a way to go back.

Very cool stuff though!
I have a use case where I need to add an HTML table to a rich text column.  I will try the CSV route
This sounds like an over-kill for such a simple task

so im running into an issue where i have the following:
```
{% set currentEmployee = hubdb_table_rows(1040995)|selectattr('email','equalto',blog_author.email) %}
{{currentEmployee|pprint}} 
```
this returns a list such as:
```
                  (PyList: [{id=9353501504, createdAt=1556906870236, path='bill-casey', name='Bill Casey', 1='{type=string, value=Bill}', 2='{type=string, value=Casey}', 3='{type=string, value=CEO, Partner}'...
```
problem is, when i do `{{currentEmployee.id}}` or try to call any other column name like `{{currentEmployee.email}}` nothing returns.
I cant figure why nothing is showing
currentEmployee looks like a list, try this
for emp in currentEmployee and then emp.id
Is there anyway I can simply do an `if` for something like `if there is content in the list do X otherwise if it's an empty list do Y`
I guess {% if currentEmployee %} should work
or try if currentEmployee |length = 0
I'll try the length filter. Didn't even think of that

so the length filter hleps eval, but I cant seem to get the ternary operator to work:
```
 {% set currentEmployee = hubdb_table_rows(1040995)|selectattr('email','equalto',blog_author.email) %}

{{ currentEmployee|length }} //outputs 1 or 0

{{ currentEmployee|length == 1 ? "yes", "no"}} // no output
```

i've also tried
```
 {% set currentEmployee = hubdb_table_rows(1040995)|selectattr('email','equalto',blog_author.email)|length %} 

{{ currentEmployee }} //outputs 1 or 0

{{ currentEmployee == 1 ? "yes", "no"}} // no output
```
ignore me, i am dumb and not using `:` :faceplam:
it looks like my dynamic pages are not using the assigned meta desc field that was assigned. No data is pulling. This is a big SEO concern...
can u link me to your page and explain the issue bit more.
<https://www.wearediagram.com/about-us/meet-the-team/aj-laporte>
In HubDB, you should be able to assign a meta description for the page using settings area
in my table, i have a column called "meta_description" and it is chosen as the meta description field in the settings. Nothing i populating for it
it populates in the og:desc and the twitter:desc but not the main meta description tag
I will look into it
Thanks Gobi, I appreciate it :slightly_smiling_face:
